answer: The policy excludes medical treatment expenses traceable to childbirth, including complicated deliveries and caesarean sections incurred during hospitalization, except ectopic pregnancy. Expenses towards miscarriage (unless due to an accident) and lawful medical termination of pregnancy during the policy period are covered. Thus, abortion is generally not covered unless it falls under the exception of miscarriage due to an accident or lawful medical termination of pregnancy.
